topic.title: Skyrim: The Journey - BIG ModPack
topic.body:
1. Download torrent file with included hotfix
1b. Download Skyrim with all 3 DLC without High Res DLC pack
-- Torrent of Skyrim will be added on this site right after this post.

2. Install english version of Skyrim: Legendary Edition (it's not included in torrent). If you have official texture packs installed, delete them. Run SkyrimLauncher.exe and choose options as shown on picture:

--IFS Upload of Pic---
http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:item+id:15f2_12BRJSQrTETJVZzt2jHdqPywv3SdugSywC_item_2391+type:image


3. Extract Skyrim.rar archive to Journey FINAL folder.

4. Copy files from The Journey FINAL/Skyrim to your installed Skyrim folder.

5. Copy files from The Journey FINAL/inis into /user/My Documents/My Games/Skyrim
If you have screen resolution different from 1980x1080, open my SkyrimPrefs.ini and choose right settings for iSize H and iSize W.

6. Copy files from The Journey FINAL/Saves into /user/My Documents/My Games/Skyrim/Saves

7. Copy files from The Journey FINAL/LoadOrder into /user/Appdata/Local/Skyrim (this folder is hidden).

8. Copy hotfix files that you downloaded along with torrent (2 files inside Data folder) into Skyrim folder. Make sure those files are in Skyrim/Data.

9. Launch game through SKSE_loader.exe.



If you have problems with FPS drops or crashes after playing for a while, try launching the game through SMC.exe. This launcher clears memory in 2 minutes interval and helps to reduce strain.

If you have low-end PC, want to free some space or want to improve stability and FPS to maximum, use 1K textures and light load order from "Light textures and loadorder" folder. Simply overwrite light textures over default. Light load order has about 20 mods removed which again lowers strain on engine and makes game more stable and smooth. You dont need SMC if you use both.


I also highly recommend to lock FPS at 30-40. You wont get crazy high fps in Journey anyways and this will make moving more smooth. If you have Nvidia card you can do it in Nvidia Inspector, choosing Skyrim profile.

topic.title: Skyrim: With Dawnguard-DragonBorn-Hearthfire
topic.body: Uploaded for those who dont already have this for the Skyrim: The Journey Torrent

FEATURES:
-All textures in game were drastically improved and optimized for the best looks/performance ratio.
-Many visual overhaul mods were used along with ENB to make Skyrim look stunning.
-Improved looks of pretty much all NPCs in game. Now they look realistic and varied.
-Completely overhauled sounds system. Using headphones is highly recommended.
-Unique soundtrack that was specifically compiled for The Journey and includes over 170 carefully chosen tracks. You won’t find it on Nexus or anywhere else.
-All cities and villages were redesigned. Many shops and taverns now have unique interiors.
-Many new places to discover including new villages, dungeons and secret hideouts.
-Vastly expanded wildlife with animals acting more realistic. Monsters list expanded tenfold and you’ll meet new creatures even after hundreds of hours of playtime.
-TONS of new loot, armors and weapons. New cool enhancements. New rare artifacts. Treasure hunting is now much more rewarding. But no ridiculous looking or overpowered stuff, everything fits well into Skyrim.
-Hundreds of new and balanced magic spells. Playing mage now is tougher early but very rewarding later on.
-In fact all specializations are much more fun to play now and have its own benefits.
-Dynamic unforgiving combat that makes you to think, react and prepare for every fight. Even wolves and bandits can give you troubles, while dragons and dragon priests will eat you alive if you aren’t prepared.
-Hundreds of new NPCs that populate roads and cities. Many random encounters making the world feel much more alive. You wont miss fast travel.
-Fully integrated Skyrim Redone overhaul that changes perk trees to make leveling more rewarding and fun.
-Several huge DLC mods including Falskaar, Wyrmstooth, Moonpath to Elsweyr, Wheels of Lull, each offering at least 10 hours of gameplay.
-Revamped economy. Making money is now harder, everything is expensive but quests are more rewarding to do.
-Better vampires and werewolves gameplay.
-Hardcore roleplay and survival. You’ll have to eat, drink, rest, care for warmth or experience severe debuffs and even death.
-Many quality of life improvements. Things you will probably not notice since it feels natural. But will miss badly if return to vanilla.
-Thousands and thousands of bug fixes.
-Close to a hundred compatibility patches to make everything work as one piece.
-Challenging, refreshing gameplay. Fast travel is disabled, starting carry weight is way lower, you can wear only limited amount of potions, arrows and lockpicks, automatic health regen is disabled, traps are deadly, locks are tough to break, leveling is slow, training/crafting takes time. On top of that The Journey features unique permadeath system where you can actually loose your character forever if not careful. But its not one death = game over and you can play through without a single reload. Read more on death mechanics and other useful info in readme.
-Impressively stable! People been saying its impossible to make Skyrim as big as 450 mods to work well. The Journey will prove them wrong.

Starting the Game:
Do NOT use BOSS or LOOT to sort load order! Use my load order instead.

Do NOT choose New Game!!! You will have many important mods disabled and wrong configs. Load my save Ragnar. You will find yourself in a cell with statue. Press Z and you get ported to customization room where you can choose name, race, gender and looks of your character. All mods settings will be transfered from my save and you will keep your own character.

When you done, click on statue and choose which start you want. I dont recommend shipwreck start. Its possible to live through, but new players will most likely freeze to death before reaching main land. If you want to play default start from Helgen - choose "I got cought crossing border illegally" (or just click on bed without interacting with statue). Then sleep in bed and game will begin.

Vanilla start is abit buggy - horse thief will fall from cart and camera might bug out if you clicked on bed in third person view. Dont worry, it wont affect anything. Also keep in mind, that when you finally get inside you will be very cold and will have to warm yourself asap near fire source.

Journey is balanced around Adept difficulty. This is the only difficulty you should start at, but you can switch to Expert or even higher at level 30+. Beware, difficulty jumps at each step beyond Adept are more harsh then in vanilla game.

If you want to turn off ENB, do it ingame by pressing SHIFT+F12.
If you decide to change ENB, make sure you have ExpandSystemMemoryX64 set to false in enblocal.ini or game will crash on startup.

PERMADEATH:
Skyrim The Journey offers hardcore experience and big part of it is Permadeath. You can die and loose your character since you wont be able to load any save with it. But its not "one death = game over". You have 2 bonus lives in the beginning. If you take fatal blow when still have bonus life, you dont die but kneel and loose a big chunk of your gold. After few seconds, health goes back to full and you can continue playing without reloading. If you wasted 2 bonus lives, third death is permanent so be very aware of this. Luckily you can replenish your bonus lives by sleeping.

Sometimes foes wont disaggro after dealing you fatal blow bu stand near waiting to finish you again. I cant change how script works, but I changed how Skooma potions work. New Skooma effect - for 15 seconds you run much faster while having huge stamina regen boost. So if you use them in time, you can easily flee from bad situations like that. But Skooma has also negative side effect. After 15 seconds your stamina is drained to zero for 42 seconds! Use it wisely and make sure you always have at least one Skooma potion if playing solo. Also probably a good idea to have one or two companions - this will make experience much easier.

Bonus lives dont work when you die from freezing or starving. Since debuff doesnt wear off after you spent a life, you will die again until its game over. So check your basic needs with C and X hotkeys regularly.

Dont forget, health regen is turned off permanently! You can can heal yourself with spells, potions, some gear enchants and bandages. Bandages are crafted at cooking pots with linen wraps.
